DOC.brief_summary: It has been shown that N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonists (such as ketamine) potentiate analgesic drug's efficacy. Polyamines are allosteric modulators of NMDA receptors. In animal studies, polyamine-free diet has shown antinociceptive properties. This research aims at evaluating analgesic properties of polyamine-low diet after laparoscopic cholecystectomy performed in an ambulatory setting.
DOC.brief_title: Polyamine-low Diet to Prevent Postoperative Pain After Cholecystectomy
DOC.criteria: laparoscopic cholecystectomy ambulatory surgery agreeing to follow a polyaminelow diet with Polydol plus Pregnancy Contraindication to a nonsteroidal antiinflammatory, to tramadol Intolerance to cow proteins Diabetic patients Poor understanding of the French language.
